newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dyckerhoff sees units boosting 97 sales.
newsitem.headline: Dyckerhoff sees units boosting 97 sales.

text.p: German building group Dyckerhoff AG said it expected its sales to rise 10 percent this year to 3.3 billion marks ($1.9 billion), largely due to the first-time consolidation of new units.
Chief executive Peter Rohde told the company's annual shareholder meeting that some four percent of this year's projected growth would be internal and six percent from units and joint ventures.

"We expect a result that follows on from the 1996 net profit and leaves room for us to strengthen our funds for further expansion as well as for a dividend payout that is pleasing to shareholders," Rohde said.
Dyckerhoff posted net profit of 151 million marks and raised its dividend to 13 marks from 12.
Sales in the first five months rose 30 percent to 1.16 billion marks.
